channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: 'We are helping innovate at the frontiers of what is possible, to evolve the sport and make it next generation': Lenovo tells us how it is working with FIFA to make the 2026 World Cup the smartest yet
item.description: Lenovo and FIFA team up to make the 2026 World Cup the smartest and most engaging yet.

item.title: The Fight for Warner Bros. Is Paramount’s Most Embarrassing Moment Yet
item.description: No one should be fighting for Warner Bros., but here we are, forced to pretend Paramount's justified in pursuing an acquisition.

item.title: Apple really went backwards when it ditched titanium on iPhones
item.description: I've already battered and bruised my iPhone 17 from the hard knocks my titanium-sporting iPhone 16 Pro Max would shrug off.

item.title: Nanometer-thick magnet produced at room temperature using lasers could one day produce better HDDs, faster non-silicon processors
item.description: Researchers show brief laser pulses can reversibly tune magnetic behavior in ultrathin materials operating at room temperature.

item.title: New TV not looking as good as you hoped? Here are 3 settings I always change to get better picture quality
item.description: While it's easier to leave your TV in its out-of-the-box settings, you'll be rewarded with a better picture if you take a trip to the menus. Here's my top 3 to get you started

item.title: Polar Grit X2 review: the Grit X2 Pro in a smaller, cheaper package
item.description: A feature-packed fitness watch let down by limited smartwatch functionality and a clunky companion app.

item.title: This new Netflix series starring Ed Westwick and John Hannah is a throwback to classic pirate movies – here are 3 of the cast’s guilty pleasures
item.description: John Hannah, Ed Westwick and Alanah Bloor reveal the pirate movies they unapologetically love – and why their new Netflix series is a ‘classic adventure love story for the modern day’.

item.title: Is Nikon pulling a Canon? What the Viltrox lawsuit rumors mean for the future of Z-mount lenses
item.description: Rumors suggest that Nikon has started legal action against the Chinese lens maker Viltrox, over alleged Z-mount patent infringements. Here's what that could mean moving forward.

item.title: Google restores much-missed JPEG XL format to Chromium code base - better image compression and better bandwidth are on the way
item.description: Google restored JPEG XL support in Chromium, enabling native decoding after years of industry pressure and growing adoption elsewhere.

item.title: ASUS will not release any new smartphones this year
item.description: ASUS appears to be shifting its business operations away from smartphones. According to translations of recent quotes from Chairman Jonney Shih, the company does not plan to release new phone models in the future. The chairman did not confirm whether smartphones would be completely phased out, but he did acknowledge that possibility. Whatever direction ASUS takes, its existing phones will continue to receive software updates and warranty assistance. Shih suggested that its future plans may include a shift into AI-related projects such as robotics or smartglasses.Previous reports hinted that AS...

item.title: I love this hidden feature on my Sony headphones, but you may not know it even exists
item.description: I love this nifty feature on my Sony headphones, but a lot of users may not even know it’s there.
